properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre is in operation on Monday to Saturdays from 8am to 8pm for those with confirmed appointments only. 

The nearest available parking is at P3 Car park on Sarah Durack Ave. Follow signage to walk to the centre, or catch the shuttle bus.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

properties.headline: SMH Half Marathon - Sunday 27 June - SYDNEY CBD, THE ROCKS, BARANGAROO & PYRMONT Macquarie St, Cahill Expressway Overpass, Western Distributor, Pirrama Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and light rail services will not operate between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 9.30am. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Overall course road closure & clearway map - SMH Half Marathon 2021
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Overall course road closure & clearway map - SMH Half Marathon 2021

properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont will start closing from 3.30am for the SMH Half Marathon with up to 10,000 participants. The course will travel from Hyde Park to Pyrmont and return via the Harbour Foreshore, Western Distributor and Cahill Expressway Overpass.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge remains open however motorists should consider using the Sydney Harbour Tunnel to avoid delays in the CBD. There will be no direct access between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge in either direction. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the city is via the Druitt St on-ramp. Access to the Harbour Bridge from the city is via Kent St and Clarence St. 

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Hyde Park from 2am to 1pm: Park St between College St and Elizabeth St (event finish line).
  • Macquarie St from 3.30am to 11.30am: Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St (event start line). Motorists can cross Macquarie St at Shakespeare Pl / Bent St before 6am and after 10:45am.
  • Circular Quay & The Rocks from 4.30am to 9am: roads north of Bent St including Bridge St, Alfred St, Pitt St, Young St, Loftus St, Macquarie St and George St / Hickson Rd north of Grosvenor St. Motorists travelling southbound on York St can access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets.
  • Western Distributor from 4am to 11am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St, Pyrmont St and Market St on-ramps and King St and Harris St off-ramps will be closed. Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off-ramp. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the CBD is via the Druitt St on-ramp or from Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour St.
  • Cahill Expressway from 4am to 11.30am: The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass will be closed. Motorists travelling southbound to the Eastern Suburbs can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or travel through the CBD to access the Eastern Distributor via York St, King St, Elizabeth St, Liverpool St and William St.
  • Pyrmont from 4.30am and 11am: Pirrama Rd, Bowman St, Union St, Murray St, Darling Drive and surrounding local roads. Motorists travelling to the city or the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be diverted via Harris St and local roads in Ultimo and Haymarket.
  • Millers Point & Barangaroo from 4.30am to 11am: Sussex St, Hickson Rd, Kent St, Pottinger St, Windmill St and Watson Rd. Access to the Rocks is maintained via York St, Lang St and Harrington St.
  • Sydney CBD from 4.30am to 11.30am: sections of Macquarie St, Bridge St, Bent St, College St, Hunter St and St James Rd. Access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets.
  • The Domain from 4.30am to 12pm: Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect between 1.30am and 12:30pm on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.

Western Distributor eastbound traffic will be diverted to Bathurst St off ramp:

  • Access to Sydney Harbour Bridge via Clarence St or Harbour St. Clarence St is recommended as Harbour St northbound will be reduced to one lane to accommodate the Wheat Rd contra-flow.

Access to CBD North via Kent Sydney Harbour Bridge southbound traffic to the Western Distributor will be diverted to Harbour St: Access to Western Distributor – left Bathurst St, left Kent St, left Druitt St Access to Pyrmont and Ultimo – right Pier St

3 Local access to Pyrmont St south of Quarry St will be via traffic control at Harris St and Quarry St. Access is via Harris St southbound then left into Quarry St only.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
KING ST WHARF, COCKLE BAY WHARF & BARANGAROO

While Hickson Rd is closed access to King St Wharf, Barangaroo South and Crown Sydney will be restricted to tenants/residents only and managed under traffic control. We strongly advise motorists to avoid non-essential travel to or from these precincts between 5am and 10am as delays are expected.

  • Before 6am and after 10am: access via Erskine St
  • From 5.30am to 10am: entry to the precinct will be managed at the northern end of Wheat Rd between the Western Distributor and King St (access from Harbour St). Exit will be managed via Wheat Rd under two-way traffic control, only for vehicles 7m and under (21 seat minibuses and smaller)

Vehicles over 7metres will be unable to use the managed exit and will need to remain within the precinct until Erskine St reopens. Before 6am and after 10am entry and exit is maintained via Erskine St at Kent St.

THE ROCKS / MILLERS POINT

From 9am to 11am, local access will be managed under traffic control at the Kent St and Erskine St intersection for access to properties on Kent St as far north as High St. Managed access from High St to Dalgety Rd, Bettington St, and Barangaroo Car Park

Prior to 9am there will be no managed vehicle access to this area due to the runners on course. Access to and from The Rocks & Dawes Point is maintained throughout the event via Lang St and Harrington St.

Vehicles are not permitted to exit a driveway or carpark onto a closed road. If you require access to your vehicle during the event you will need to relocate it outside the closure footprint prior to the road closures. Once roads are closed no vehicle movements will be permitted until the roads have safely reopened.

CIRCULAR QUAY

Circular Quay Roads closed between 4:30am and 9:00am, traffic control will manage vehicles exiting from properties at the times and locations below.

  • From 4:30am to 6:00am: exit only via Phillip St southbound and exit only via Pitt St
  • From 6:00am to 8:30am: no exit
  • From 8:30am to 9:00am: exit via Phillip St southbound if safe to allow

SYDNEY CBD

Sydney Hospital/Hospital Road

Between 4:30am and 11:30am access to Hospital Rd and Sydney Hospital is via Shakespeare Pl under two-way traffic control

PYRMONT

Access into Pyrmont will be available via Pier Street and Harris Street or via the Pyrmont Bridge Road (Fish Market) off-ramp and Allen Street off-ramp from the Western Distributor. We strongly advise to delay any non-essential travel through the area until roads have reopened

  • Pyrmont St south of Quarry St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left Quarry St, right Pyrmont St. Exit the same way under two-way traffic control.
  • Residential access to Gipps St and Experiment St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left into Allen St

Murray St between Union St and Pyrmont St

  • between 4:30am and 11am: enter via Darling Dr
  • between 4:30am and 9:15am: exit via Darling Dr

Pyrmont St residential car park driveways between Bunn Ln and Allen St: no access between 6am and 9:15am
arrangementElements.title: Local access arrangements

arrangementElements.html:
CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD - From 4:30AM to 9:00AM

  • Pitt St between Alfred St and Bridge St    

SYDNEY CBD / PYRMONT - From 4:30AM to 11:00AM

  • King St between Kent St and Sussex St  
  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St    

CYCLIST DETOURS

From 6:45AM to 10:15AM  

Cycling detours will be in place between Kent St cycleway and Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway, via Observatory Hill. Marshals will direct cyclists across Upper Fort St in both directions when safe gaps between runners present. Alternatively, cyclists can travel between Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and Sydney CBD via Cumberland St.

  • To Sydney Harbour Bridge from Kent Street cycleway - turn right Kent St on ramp shared path,  cycling/pedestrian bridge to Upper Fort St, left Sydney Observatory access road, right Observatory Hill shared path, proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal
  • To Kent Street from Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway - proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal, proceed via Observatory Hill shared path, turn left onto Sydney Observatory access road, right to the cycling/pedestrian bridge and Kent St on ramp shared path, proceed to Kent Street cycleway
arrangementElements.title: Cycleway closures and detours

roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, The Rocks, Barangaroo & Pyrmont

properties.headline: Western Sydney Marathon - Sunday 27 June - CASTLEREAGH Old Castlereagh Rd at Sydney International Regatta Centre
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 2,000 participants are expected to take part in a series of events in the Western Sydney Marathon at the Sydney International Regatta Centre between 7am and 1pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual throughout the day as participants travel to and from the events. Allow extra time on Old Castlereagh Rd and Castlereagh Rd approaching the regatta.

Parking on site available via Gate C on Old Castlereagh Rd.

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 2 July - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Eels at BlueBet Stadium. Kick off from 7.55pm, full-time around 9.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the game during the busy Friday evening peak.

Fans should allow extra time as parking is limited in the area and will be in high demand.

properties.headline: AFL - Sunday 27 June - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road approaching GIANTS Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Hawthorn at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce from 1.10pm, finish around 3.45pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Silverwater Rd, Hill Rd, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to and from the game. 

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before the game.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road

properties.headline: Music festival - Friday 25 June to Sunday 18 July - SYDNEY Art Gallery Road at Hospital Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Winter in the Domain concert series at the Phillip Precinct. Start and finish times vary between Friday 25 June and Sunday 18 July.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in the CBD approaching The Domain as fans travel to and from the concerts, particularly during the weekday evening peaks. There are no internal or external planned road closures.

Fans travelling by rideshare or taxi should allow extra travel time and plan to get there early. An event drop off zone will be located on Hospital Road.
properties.displayName: Music festival - Friday 25 June to Sunday 18 July

properties.headline: NRL - Thursday 1 July - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Storm at the SCG. Kick off from 7.50pm, finish around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium on during the Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.50pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Motorists travelling south on the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park near Moore Park Rd will not open for this event. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM - THURSDAY 1 JULY

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street* between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Map Attachments

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Festival - Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 June - CLARENDON Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road approaching Hawkesbury Showground
properties.publicTransport: Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport to avoid traffic delays. Clarendon Station is a short walk from the showgrounds. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,500 people are expected to attend Winterfest event at Hawkesbury Showground on Saturday and Sunday from 10am until 5pm each day. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd and Richmond Rd approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic control, allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.  

No parking will be available along Racecourse Rd from Clarendon Station to the showground entry.

roads.mainStreet: Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 2 July - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Warriors v Dragons at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford. Kick off from 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game Friday evening. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 4pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 3 July - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Sea Eagles at Bankwest Stadium from 3pm until 5pm approx.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL -  Saturday 3 July - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Cowboys at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick off from 7:35pm, full-time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 4 July - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Rabbitohs from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event during Sunday afternoon.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League Semi Final - Sunday 20 June - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Semi Final: Melbourne City v Macarthur FC at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick off from 4.05pm, finish around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium on Sunday afternoon.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 20 June - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Bulldogs at Bankwest Stadium. Kick off from 2pm, full-time around 3.45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Fans driving to the game should arrive early as parking will be in high demand. 

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time from around 3:30pm for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Expect delays and follow directions of traffic control and Police on site while closures are in place.

properties.headline: Expo - Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 June - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road approaching Sydney Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Supanova Comic Con at Sydney Showground from 10am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Silverwater Rd, Hill Rd, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as attendees travel to and from the event over the weekend. 

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road
